qas.question: What year was Koch awarded a Nobel Prize?
Koch's conviction that human and bovine strains of TB were unrelated meant more people were exposed by drinking what?
What did Koch call the ineffective treatment for TB he came up with in 1890?
What event is celebrated on March 24th to recognize the test for latent TB?
What did Koch believe was similar to bovine tuberculosis?
What year did World Tuberculosis Day start?
What remedy did Koch win a Nobel prize for?
When did Koch describe the connection between TB and infected milk?

context: The bacillus causing tuberculosis, M. tuberculosis, was identified and described on <b9_0>24 March 1882<b9_0/> by <a0_0><b5_0>Robert Koch<b5_0/><a0_0/>. He received the Nobel Prize in physiology or medicine in <a1_0>1905<a1_0/> for this discovery. Koch did not believe the bovine (cattle) and <b6_0>human tuberculosis<b6_0/> diseases were similar, which delayed the recognition of infected <a2_0>milk<a2_0/> as a source of infection. Later, the risk of transmission from this source was dramatically reduced by the invention of the pasteurization process. Koch announced a glycerine extract of the tubercle bacilli as a "remedy" for tuberculosis in <b7_0>1890<b7_0/>, calling it "<a3_0><b8_0>tuberculin<b8_0/><a3_0/>". While it was not effective, it was later successfully adapted as a screening test for the presence of pre-symptomatic tuberculosis. The <a4_0>World Tuberculosis Day<a4_0/> was established on 24 March for this reason.
